info.name: Books Rest API collection
info.description:
## üìö Books REST API - Collection Documentation

Welcome to the **Books REST API Postman Collection**! _**This API manages a many-to-many relationship between books and authors. It provides CRUD operations for both entities.**_ This collection provides a complete set of endpoints to perform CRUD operations on books and authors, perfect for testing your Spring Boot project.

### üîó Base URL

All requests use the collection variable {{baseUrl}}.

example: {{baseUrl}} = [http://localhost:8080/](http://localhost:8080/)

### üìñ API Endpoints

#### üìò Books

- **GET** `/api/books`
    
    - Fetch all books.
        
- **GET** `/api/books/{id}`
    
    - Fetch a book by ID.
        
- **POST** `/api/books`
    
    - Create a new book.
        
    - Body: JSON with book details.
        
- **PUT** `/api/books/{id}`
    
    - Update an existing book.
        
    - Body: JSON with updated fields.
        
- **DELETE** `/api/books/{id}`
    
    - Delete a book by ID.
        

#### ‚úçÔ∏è Authors

- **GET** `/api/authors`
    
    - Fetch all authors.
        
- **GET** `/api/authors/{id}`
    
    - Fetch an author by ID.
        
- **POST** `/api/authors`
    
    - Create a new author.
        
    - Body: JSON with author details.
        
- **PUT** `/api/authors/{id}`
    
    - Update an existing author.
        
    - Body: JSON with updated fields.
        
- **DELETE** `/api/authors/{id}`
    
    - Delete an author by ID.
        

---

### ‚úÖ Requirements

- Java and Spring Boot application running locally or on a server.
    
- The database connected and migrations applied (if any).
    

---

### üîÑ How to Use

1. **Set Base URL**
    
    - Open the collection‚Äôs Variables tab.
        
    - Update `baseUrl` to match your API server.
        
2. **Run Requests**
    
    - Use individual requests to manually test.
        
    - Or use the **Runner** to automate the collection.
        
3. **Collection Variables**
    
    - baseUrl - the root URL of your API.
        

---

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Notes

- All endpoints accept and return JSON.
    
- HTTP status codes follow REST conventions (`200 OK`, `201 Created`, `204 No Content`, `404 Not Found`, etc.).
    
- Use appropriate headers:
    

\*Content-Type: application/json  
\*Accept: application/json

### üöÄ Author

This collection was created by **Anuj Kumar** for the Spring Boot Books REST API project.  
Feel free to customize and share!

item.description:
- Create new Authors.
    
- Retreive all Authors or single Author by ID.
    
- Update Author Details.
    
- Delete individual Atuhor or all Authors in the System.

item.name: Books

response.name: Get All Books
Specific Book
update Book with Authors

item.description:
- Create new books and associate them with existing authors.
    
- Retrieve all books or a single book by ID.
    
- Update book details, including its associated authors.
    
- Delete individual books or all books in the system.
